column1: This article discusses the health effects from an overdose of diphenhydramine, a type of medicine called an antihistamine, which is found in various allergy and sleep medicines.

Bladder and kidneys: - Inability to urinate Eyes, ears, nose, mouth, and throat: - Blurred vision - Dry mouth - Enlarged pupils - Severely dry eyes - Ringing in the ears Heart and blood vessels: - Low blood pressure - Rapid heartbeat Nervous system: - Agitation - Confusion - Convulsions (seizures) - Delirium - Depression - Drowsiness - Hallucinations - Increased sleepiness - Nervousness - Seizures - Tremor - Unsteadiness Skin: - Dry, flushed, red skin
